chart.title: Life expectancy vs. health expenditure
chart.subtitle: Health expenditure includes all financing schemes and covers all aspects of healthcare. This data is adjusted for inflation and differences in the cost of living between countries.
chart.note: Health expenditure data is expressed in [international-$](#dod:int_dollar_abbreviation) at 2015 prices.
chart.citation: UN, World Population Prospects (2024); OECD Health Expenditure and Financing Database (2023)

Life expectancy - Sex: all - Age: 0 - Va.descriptionShort: Period life expectancy for individuals who have reached age 0. Estimates are expressed as the expected age at death, not as years left to live.
Life expectancy - Sex: all - Age: 0 - Va.citationShort: UN, World Population Prospects (2024) – processed by Our World in Data
Life expectancy - Sex: all - Age: 0 - Va.citationLong: UN, World Population Prospects (2024) – processed by Our World in Data. “Life Expectancy,age 0 – UN WPP” [dataset]. United Nations, “World Population Prospects” [original data].

Health expenditure per capita - Total.descriptionShort: Health expenditure in total divided by population. Includes all health care financing schemes: government, compulsory contributory insurance, voluntary insurance, household out-of-pocket payments, and rest of the world financing schemes.
descriptionKey: The data is measured in international-$ at 2015 prices – this adjusts for inflation and for differences in the cost of living between countries.
Health expenditure per capita - Total.citationShort: OECD Health Expenditure and Financing Database (2023) – with minor processing by Our World in Data
Health expenditure per capita - Total.citationLong: OECD Health Expenditure and Financing Database (2023) – with minor processing by Our World in Data. “Health expenditure per capita - Total” [dataset]. OECD Health Expenditure and Financing Database, “OECD Health Expenditure and Financing Database” [original data].

Population (historical).descriptionShort: Population by country, available from 10,000 BCE to 2023, based on data and estimates from different sources.
Population (historical).descriptionProcessing:
The population data is constructed by combining data from multiple sources:

- 10,000 BCE - 1799: Historical estimates by HYDE (v3.3).

- 1800 - 1949: Historical estimates by Gapminder (v7).

- 1950-2023: Population records by the UN World Population Prospects (2024 revision).
Population (historical).citationShort: HYDE (2023); Gapminder (2022); UN WPP (2024) – with major processing by Our World in Data
Population (historical).citationLong: HYDE (2023); Gapminder (2022); UN WPP (2024) – with major processing by Our World in Data. “Population (historical)” [dataset]. PBL Netherlands Environmental Assessment Agency, “History Database of the Global Environment 3.3”; Gapminder, “Population v7”; United Nations, “World Population Prospects”; Gapminder, “Systema Globalis” [original data].

Continent.citationShort: – processed by Our World in Data
Continent.citationLong: – processed by Our World in Data. “Continent” [dataset]. Our World In Data [original data].
